advantages: Width and depth of enterprise clients.
Connected with high-level decision makers of clients.
challenges: Long and bureaucratic due diligence processes.
Cannot be strategic right from the get-go, need to be tactful initially until the rapport and initial success stories are established.
recommendations: Focus on ‘influenced deals’; bring leads to GSIs for influenced and quicker closures.
Push for building and articulating thought leadership solutions for clients.
Leverage hyperscaler practices - cloud consumption quotas, marketplace offers, etc.
One size doesn’t fit all - Different stakeholders within GSIs have different priorities. Practice teams understand tech and innovation; client sales team focuses on services revenues, and so on.

advantages: SIs are agile & eager for new tech.
recommendations: Push for quick POCs to drive adoption.
Enable thought leadership for clients.
Focus on enabling the SI team with product skillset.
One size doesn’t fit all - Different stakeholders within SIs have different priorities. Practice teams understand tech and innovation; client sales team focuses on services revenues, and so on.
Offer high-margin reseller incentives.

advantages: Deep domain expertise with strong CXO-level connects.
Quick ramp up in tech and sales.
recommendations: Identify and align with industry-focused consulting plays.
Focus on core competency & brand positioning.
Offer co-branded GTM strategies to expand credibility.

advantages: Strong brand influence with enterprise clients.
challenges: Highly fragmented structure with geo-specific teams & processes.
High barriers to entry (due diligence, existing tech, etc.).
recommendations: Talk about existing Big4 partnerships to the fore to induce FOMO, if applicable.
Initially focus on ‘influenced deals’; bring leads to GSIs for influenced and quicker closures.
Leverage Hyperscaler relationships for co-sell opportunities.

advantages: High visibility via Cloud Solution Providers (CSPs) and Partner Selling & Reselling.
High Marketing Development Funds (MDFs) & co-branding opportunities.
challenges: Product strategy should align with hyperscalers.
Upfront revenue and CSP commitments (MAC Agreement, etc.).
recommendations: Leverage GSI, SI, and CSP partnerships to accelerate joint opportunities.
Leverage exclusive incentives on Cloud Marketplaces.
Identify opportunities for joint solutions and thought leaderships (GenAI, AI-driven automation, etc.).

advantages: One-stop shop for customer value proposition.
challenges: Might have limited existing customer base.
Product strategy should align with ISVs.
Very little scope to incentivize ISV sales team on the JVP.
recommendations: Develop mutual enablement programs (sales & tech).
Focus on joint solution packaging with ISVs.
Identify vertical-specific GTM plays for better positioning.

challenges: Little to no control over pricing.
Higher rebates or sales comp required.
Geo-specific, hence, complicated to manage partner ecosystem.
recommendations: Identify high-margin, low-intent markets for rapid adoption (GCC, APAC, etc.).
Set up partner enablement teams (sales & tech).
Set up partner portal for partners to register deals and track progress.
Incentivize partners on partner tiers.
